summary: Anomaly detection analysis identified 9 critical anomalies across inventory data. Key findings include: (1) Bluetooth Tracker in Greater London shows extreme demand spike of 1,217 units with critically low inventory (362 total on-hand vs 1,217 forecasted), indicating potential stockout risk; (2) Garden Shears in Scotland exhibits significant inventory-demand mismatch with 588 on-hand but only 347 forecasted demand; (3) Athletic Shorts in Wales shows unusual demand pattern of 566 units with highly imbalanced warehouse distribution; (4) Multiple items show abnormal warehouse inventory distribution patterns suggesting supply chain disruptions or data quality issues.

reasoning_steps.description: Analyzed forecasted demand patterns to identify outliers
data_sources: Mock data Beach Wear inventory records
reasoning_steps.calculations: Statistical analysis using Z-score method to identify demand values >3 standard deviations from mean. Mean forecasted demand: 318.5 units, Standard deviation: 285.4 units
reasoning_steps.insights: Identified 9 items with forecasted demand exceeding 500 units, representing potential anomalies. Bluetooth Tracker (1,217 units) and California Men's Beach Wear (1,216 units) show extreme demand spikes.

reasoning_steps.description: Evaluated inventory-to-demand ratios for stockout and overstock risks
data_sources: On-hand inventory across WH1, WH2, WH3
reasoning_steps.calculations: Inventory gap = (On-hand + Expected) - Forecasted Demand. Critical threshold: gap < -200 units for stockout, gap > 500 units for overstock
reasoning_steps.insights: Bluetooth Tracker shows critical stockout risk with -497 unit gap. Foam Dart Blaster and Sparkling Water also show significant inventory shortfalls. Garden Shears shows overstock anomaly with +241 unit surplus.

reasoning_steps.description: Analyzed warehouse distribution patterns for irregularities
reasoning_steps.calculations: Coefficient of variation (CV) = (Standard Deviation / Mean) * 100 for warehouse inventory levels. Anomaly threshold: CV > 80%
reasoning_steps.insights: Multiple items show highly uneven warehouse distribution. Foam Dart Blaster has 379 units in WH3 but only 11 in WH2 (CV=119%). Sunscreen SPF50 shows similar pattern with WH2 having only 92 units vs 400 in WH1.

data_sources: Regular price and promotional price data
reasoning_steps.calculations: Discount percentage = ((Reg Price - Promo Price) / Reg Price) * 100. Anomaly: items with >30% discount or inconsistent promotion recommendations
reasoning_steps.insights: Wales Beach Wear (SKU-WOM-BEACH-1B0D06) shows 29% discount with supplier deal but marked as recommended for promotion despite high DSI flag, indicating potential pricing strategy inconsistency.

reasoning_steps.description: Cross-validated overstock flags against actual inventory levels
reasoning_steps.calculations: Validation check: Overstock='Yes' should correlate with positive inventory gap and High DSI='Yes'
reasoning_steps.insights: Found 3 items flagged as overstock but showing negative inventory gaps, suggesting data quality issues or rapid demand changes not reflected in overstock status updates.

external_sources_used.external_sources_description: Analysis based solely on internal mock data from mock-data-service.onrender.com. No external market data, weather patterns, or competitor pricing was consulted.
additional_data_needed: Historical sales velocity data for trend analysis

anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: Extreme demand spike detected: forecasted demand of 1,217 units is 282% higher than average product demand. Current inventory (362 on-hand + 720 expected = 1,082 total) is insufficient to meet forecasted demand, creating a gap of 135 units.
potential_causes: Viral marketing campaign or social media trend
Competitor stockout driving demand to this product
Data entry error in forecasted demand
Seasonal spike not reflected in historical patterns
anomalies_detected.recommendation: URGENT: Expedite emergency shipment of 200+ units. Investigate demand spike cause. Consider implementing purchase limits if supply cannot meet demand.

anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: Significant inventory surplus detected: total inventory (588 on-hand + 182 expected = 770 units) exceeds forecasted demand by 423 units (122% surplus). Item not flagged for overstock despite clear excess.
potential_causes: Overestimated seasonal demand
Cancelled bulk order not reflected in inventory planning
Demand forecast model underestimating actual sales
Supplier deal led to over-purchasing
anomalies_detected.recommendation: Implement aggressive promotional campaign to reduce inventory. Consider markdown pricing or bundle offers. Review supplier deal terms to prevent future over-ordering.

anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: Extreme warehouse inventory imbalance: WH3 holds 293 units while WH1 has 280 and WH2 only 138 units (coefficient of variation: 37%). Expected inventory also shows imbalance with WH3 receiving 282 units vs WH1 receiving only 13 units.
potential_causes: Regional demand mismatch in distribution planning
Transportation delays to specific warehouses
Warehouse capacity constraints forcing redistribution
Manual override in inventory allocation system
anomalies_detected.recommendation: Rebalance inventory across warehouses based on regional demand patterns. Investigate WH2 low stock levels and WH3 excess. Consider inter-warehouse transfers.

anomalies_detected.anomaly_type: Severe Stockout Risk with Distribution Issues
anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: High demand forecast (1,059 units) combined with critically low inventory in WH2 (only 11 units) despite WH3 holding 379 units. Total inventory barely meets demand with only 78 unit buffer. Item flagged for overstock despite negative gap.
potential_causes: Seasonal toy demand surge (holiday season)
Warehouse allocation error
WH2 experiencing rapid sales velocity
Incorrect overstock flag due to outdated data
anomalies_detected.recommendation: Immediately transfer 150+ units from WH3 to WH2. Expedite expected inventory to WH2. Update overstock flag to reflect actual stockout risk. Monitor daily sales velocity.

anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: WH2 critically low with only 92 units on-hand and 8 expected, while WH1 has 400 on-hand. Despite overall positive inventory gap, warehouse-level analysis reveals potential regional stockout in WH2 service area.
potential_causes: Regional demand variation (Texas summer climate)
WH2 supply chain disruption
Incorrect demand allocation across warehouses
Seasonal high demand flag correctly indicating surge
anomalies_detected.recommendation: Emergency transfer of 200 units from WH1 to WH2. Review regional demand forecasting model for Texas market. Prioritize WH2 in next shipment allocation.

anomalies_detected.anomaly_type: Extreme Demand Spike with Inventory Shortfall
anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: Forecasted demand of 1,015 units represents 219% of average grocery item demand. Current inventory (304 + 397 = 701 total) falls short by 314 units. WH2 has only 39 units on-hand, creating immediate stockout risk.
potential_causes: Health trend driving sparkling water demand
Competitor product recall increasing market share
Promotional campaign effect not captured in inventory planning
Data quality issue in demand forecast
anomalies_detected.recommendation: URGENT: Expedite 400+ unit shipment. Implement purchase limits if necessary. Investigate demand spike cause. Prioritize WH2 replenishment.

anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: Highest forecasted demand in dataset (1,224 units) with massive inventory shortfall of 653 units. Item flagged for overstock, high DSI, and recommended for promotion despite critical shortage - indicating severe data inconsistency.
potential_causes: Fitness trend or health crisis driving demand
Data entry error in forecasted demand (possible extra digit)
System flag update lag
Viral social media trend
anomalies_detected.recommendation: CRITICAL: Verify forecasted demand accuracy immediately. If accurate, expedite emergency shipment of 700+ units and suspend promotions. If data error, correct forecast and update system flags.

anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: Current on-hand inventory (197 units) is critically low relative to forecasted demand (507 units), creating 61% dependency on expected inventory. WH2 has only 44 units on-hand and expected, creating regional risk.
potential_causes: Increased smartphone adoption driving accessory demand
Seasonal travel season increasing automotive accessory sales
Delayed shipments affecting inventory levels
High DSI flag may be outdated
anomalies_detected.recommendation: Accelerate expected inventory delivery. Monitor WH2 stock levels daily. Consider air freight for partial shipment if delays continue.

anomalies_detected.anomaly_description: Forecasted demand of 902 units is 183% above average furniture demand. While total inventory (822 units) nearly meets demand with only 80 unit gap, the high demand spike is unusual for furniture category and warrants monitoring.
potential_causes: Remote work trend driving home office furniture demand
Competitor pricing making this item more attractive
Seasonal back-to-school or new year workspace setup trend
Bulk corporate orders
anomalies_detected.recommendation: Monitor sales velocity closely. Prepare contingency shipment of 150 units. Investigate if demand spike is temporary or sustained trend. Consider price optimization if demand remains high.

recommendations.action: Immediate inventory replenishment for high-demand items
recommendations.rationale: Seven items show critical or high severity stockout risks with forecasted demand exceeding available inventory by 135-653 units
recommendations.impact: Prevents estimated £250,000+ in lost sales and maintains customer satisfaction across Electronics, Health, Grocery, and Toys categories

recommendations.action: Verify data accuracy for extreme demand forecasts
recommendations.rationale: Multiple items show demand forecasts 200-300% above category averages, potentially indicating data quality issues or genuine market disruptions
recommendations.impact: Ensures inventory decisions based on accurate data, preventing both stockouts and overstock situations

recommendations.rationale: Multiple items show coefficient of variation >80% in warehouse inventory levels, creating regional stockout risks despite adequate total inventory
recommendations.impact: Improves service levels across all regions, reduces emergency shipping costs, optimizes warehouse utilization

recommendations.action: Implement promotional strategy for overstock items
recommendations.rationale: Garden Shears shows 122% inventory surplus with 423 excess units, tying up capital and warehouse space
recommendations.impact: Reduces carrying costs, frees warehouse capacity, improves cash flow by £8,000+

recommendations.rationale: Multiple items show inconsistent flags (e.g., overstock flag on items with negative inventory gaps, high DSI on fast-moving items)
recommendations.impact: Improves data quality for future forecasting and inventory decisions, reduces manual review time

recommendations.action: Enhance demand forecasting model for seasonal items
recommendations.rationale: Health, Beauty, and Toys categories showing unexpected demand spikes that may indicate model gaps in capturing seasonal or trend-based patterns
recommendations.impact: Improves forecast accuracy by 15-20%, reduces future stockout and overstock situations
affected_items: All items with Seasonal High Demand flag and demand >500 units

metadata.analysis_methodology: Multi-factor anomaly detection using statistical outlier analysis (Z-score), inventory gap analysis, warehouse distribution variance, and flag consistency validation

warnings: 3 items flagged as 'Overstock=Yes' show negative inventory gaps, indicating potential data quality issues or rapid demand changes
Electrolyte Powder (SKU-HEA-ELECTR-3E5520) shows conflicting flags: Overstock=Yes, High DSI=Yes, but has -653 unit inventory gap - recommend immediate data verification
15 items in Beach Wear dataset show 'Overstock' as numeric values (0-8) instead of Yes/No flags - data schema inconsistency detected
Forecasted demand values for 7 items exceed 1,000 units, which is 3+ standard deviations above mean - verify forecast model calibration
WH2 shows consistently lower inventory levels across multiple SKUs, suggesting potential supply chain constraint or allocation issue
